segment.source: How to Configure the Application Virtualization Streaming Servers
segment.target: How to Configure the Application Virtualization Streaming Servers

segment.source: How to Configure the Application Virtualization Streaming Servers
segment.target: How to Configure the Application Virtualization Streaming Servers

segment.source: How to Configure the Application Virtualization Streaming Servers
segment.target: How to Configure the Application Virtualization Streaming Servers

segment.source: Before virtual applications can be streamed to the Application Virtualization Desktop Client or the Client for Remote Desktop Services (formerly Terminal Services), the Application Virtualization Streaming Servers must be configured.
segment.target: Before virtual applications can be streamed to the Application Virtualization Desktop Client or the Client for Remote Desktop Services (formerly Terminal Services), the Application Virtualization Streaming Servers must be configured.

segment.source: When you configure the servers, you are setting up the content directory where the SFT files are loaded and stored.
segment.target: When you configure the servers, you are setting up the content directory where the SFT files are loaded and stored.

segment.source: The SFT files contain the virtual application (or applications).
segment.target: The SFT files contain the virtual application (or applications).

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Application Virtualization Servers stream SFT files to the Desktop Client and the Client for Remote Desktop Services using only RTSP or RTSPS protocols.
segment.target: Application Virtualization Servers stream SFT files to the Desktop Client and the Client for Remote Desktop Services using only RTSP or RTSPS protocols.

segment.source: The ICO (icon) file and the OSD (open software descriptor) file can be configured to stream from a different file or HTTP server.
segment.target: The ICO (icon) file and the OSD (open software descriptor) file can be configured to stream from a different file or HTTP server.

segment.source: To configure the Application Virtualization Streaming Servers
segment.target: To configure the Application Virtualization Streaming Servers

segment.source: Complete the installation procedure for the Application Virtualization Streaming Server.
segment.target: Complete the installation procedure for the Application Virtualization Streaming Server.

segment.source: During the installation procedure, you specify the location of the Content directory on the Content Path screen.
segment.target: During the installation procedure, you specify the location of the Content directory on the Content Path screen.

segment.source: Navigate to the location that you specified for the Content directory, and if you have to, create the directory.
segment.target: Navigate to the location that you specified for the Content directory, and if you have to, create the directory.

segment.source: When the Content directory is created, configure this directory as a standard file share.
segment.target: When the Content directory is created, configure this directory as a standard file share.

segment.source: Configure the NTFS file system permissions to the Content directory and the package folders under the Content directory.
segment.target: Configure the NTFS file system permissions to the Content directory and the package folders under the Content directory.

segment.source: You should use Security Groups in Active Directory Domain Services that define which users can access each application.
segment.target: You should use Security Groups in Active Directory Domain Services that define which users can access each application.
